scrooge
  • Reference

    • Residual analysis for community detection

Calculate Pearson profile residuals

Residuals are calculated using the formula $$r_i = \frac{y_i - \hat{y}_i}{\sqrt{\hat{y}_i}}$$ which treats each element of the citation counts vector as a Poisson variate. If the expected value is zero, NA is returned. (You can decide for yourself whether to omit these observations, treat them as zero or use some other approach.)

profile_residuals(expected, observed)

Arguments

expected

Predicted vector of citations, based on some model
observed

Vector of observed citations from the journal of interest

Value

A numeric vector of standardised residuals, the same length as expected and observed

Details

We might want to make a generic S3 function like stats::residuals(). Deviance residuals may be added later. For now we have Pearson residuals only.

References

Agresti, Alan (2002). Categorical Data Analysis (2nd ed., pp. 366--367). New York, NY: Wiley.

See also

stats::rstandard.glm()

Other functions for residual analysis of communities: community_residuals, fitted_citations

Examples

# Compare citations of 'Biometrika' to those of all stats journals
Bka_counts <- citations[, 'Bka']
average_profile <- rowSums(citations) / sum(citations)
expected_counts <- average_profile * sum(Bka_counts)
profile_residuals(expected_counts, Bka_counts)
#>         AmS        AISM         AoS        ANZS        Bern        BioJ 
#> -1.76297802 -0.98156976  4.96238240 -0.29637222 -0.92793177 -0.14562603 
#>         Bcs         Bka       Biost         CJS        CSSC        CSTM 
#> -0.17154994  9.07090148  1.06660040 -0.74002496 -2.09141147 -3.34070833 
#>       CmpSt        CSDA         EES        Envr         ISR       JABES 
#> -0.51850701 -3.71977308 -1.51864806 -1.38097669 -1.57856126 -1.45627202 
#>        JASA         JAS         JBS        JCGS         JMA         JNS 
#>  3.69607101 -1.96056621 -2.28523373  0.05265299 -1.20560201 -1.51738180 
#>      JRSS-A      JRSS-B      JRSS-C        JSCS        JSPI         JSS 
#> -1.21646075  2.28783497  1.32243924 -1.65180107 -1.65722041 -1.16262346 
#>        JTSA         LDA        Mtka         SJS      StataJ       StCmp 
#> -1.96056621  1.59083358 -1.05972726  1.37141341 -1.71537471 -0.26205310 
#>       Stats       StMed        SMMR       StMod       StNee       StPap 
#> -0.52327667 -3.38149096 -0.93014454 -1.48332583 -1.25061467 -1.47436305 
#>         SPL       StSci       StSin        Tech        Test 
#> -2.55171850  1.49377439  2.94127377 -1.88943431  0.26771858
